name: The Arctic Club Seattle - a DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Doubletree Arctic Club is not like a standard Doubletree AT ALL, it has a sumptious luxury boutique hotel feel. Not to mention it is on the National Register of Historic Places.
reviews.title: More like a luxury Boutique hotel than a Doubletree

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: As soon as you walk in you feel like you have stepped back in time, rich wood accents, and black and white framed photos greet you. Everything is elegant. Check-in was quick. We were using Hilton reward points for our stay and were upgraded to a top floor suite.
reviews.title: Awesome rooms - unfortunately had a fire alarm malfunction

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The room was amazing! The bathroom was HUGE, complimented with marble countertop and tasteful tile work. The décor had a feel of contemporary and classic at the same time. The outdoor rooftop balcony was a nice extra. The bed was heaven! Our stay here more than pleasantly surprised us, HIGHLY recommend.
reviews.title: Beautifully updates to a classic property with great service and super comfy beds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is only three blocks from Pioneer Square, close to I-5 and roughly 20 minutes from the airport.
reviews.title: Old World Charm & Courtesy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: For dinner, the Space Needle is touristy but worth the visit. The views are unbeatable especially if you go when you can watch the sunset. The food is very good and the wait staff extra attentive.
reviews.title: Great Vibe,Bed Bugs!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011
reviews.text: We had a great stay here. We were on a short break from victoria and we have stayed in several hotels in seattle before but this was by far the best. The rooms are all themed as if you were travelling in the 1800s but are a great size. The bar and the Food are excellent and the hotel is close to downtown and a 5 minute walk to pike place we will definatley stay there again
reviews.title: A great boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: First the down side. It's located several blocks off the beaten path in downtown and close to what is a changing area somewhat fraught with urban challenges. Get used to frequent police sirens and ambulences sent to pick up stabbing victims a few blocks away. Most of the crime is related to homelessness, poverty and alcohol and drug use and not aimed at tourists or residents. Seattle has always had a plethora of Native America, African-American and other street people. The economy isn't helping. So, with that out of the way, let me state that this is a lovely, well-maintained property. The building's history is fascinating, as are some of the decor items used throughout that were part of the original property. Front desk, valet and room service staff were, for the most part, professional, warm and responsive. Rooms are varied in layout, but well appointed and extremely comfortable. Nice big bathrooms make up for somewhat smaller rooms, but it makes for a very nice stay. The main part of downtown is a pleasant 10 minute walk away, along with Pikes Place and other tourist areas. Seattle is a great walking city so take advantage of it. Your body will thank you!
reviews.title: A Lovely, Historic Property
Fantastic hotel with a "Boutique" feel.
reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic hotel. Rooms had character, were clean, and the service was terrific.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: From the valets to the maid staff these folks aim to please. They all called me by name and were eager to make my stay memorable.
reviews.title: Old World Luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The rooms are very well appointed. Large flatscreens, comfortable workspace, jacuzzi tub and french doors to the bathroom. Well done.
reviews.title: Classic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights recently and the staff could not have been more friendly or accommodating. The location is great - close to transit stops, but I simply walked everywhere. I had only one meal there --- some late-night room service, and I even Facebooked to my friends how innovative and tasty that one silly snack was! Highly recommended. I can't speak to any of the other amenities of the hotel (fitness room, restaurant, bar, etc).
reviews.title: Lovely details, comfy room, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: What I particularly enjoyed was the care with which they restored the hotel. I loved the architecture of the building itself, but the care of the re-design and the details -- really great. Lovely colors. Modern but appropriately retro features, including reproduction doors and inspired lighting features. I found the elevator number panel particularly amusing, though I'm not entirely sure it was intended to sound like a submarine.
reviews.title: Beautiful and Clean Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: I had only 2 problems while I was there. One, I had requested a corner room (which allowed for great light, but also increased street noise - be prepared if you are sensitive to this). This gave me lovely partial views of Rainier and the Sound, but also let me overlook a construction site. I asked for a room change to a better view, but they were not able to provide one with similar features. Seeing the placement of the hotel in daylight, I could see why - because it is a historic hotel, it is moderately dwarfed by its neighbors, which means no one has a tremendous view; and the hotel is blocked by other properties. But that's really just fine - I was there for sleeping and working, and you can enjoy all the fantastic views of Seattle by getting out.
reviews.title: Love this hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My other problem was a clogged sink, and I only reported it upon checkout. I do believe someone had jammed the sink with tobacco, because there was an odor of tobacco whenever I ran water. Again, as soon as I reported the problem upon checkout, the concierge was calling maintenance in to unclog the sink.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommended - would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Wonderful stay at the Artic Club

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have never been to Seattle, but my husband and I were cruising to Alaska and chose the Arctic Club because it is in the Hilton Family (Diamond members), had good reviews and seemed a good location to downtown. We stayed pre (one night) and post (2 nights) cruise. Lobby with bar is lovely and quiet place to relax. The room we were given for the pre-cuise night was on the 6th floor and very, very, very small. You really can't turn around in this room. However, we were okay with it because we were only staying one night. The room is beautiful with all new bedding (wonderfully comfortable), two tall windows (no view), dark chocolate crown moldings and a dresser with built-in refrigerator and coffee/tea bar. The desk is fitted with business traveler needs (pens, paper, highlighter, stapler). The bathroom is quite nice with hairdryer, make up mirror and small bottles of shampoo, conditioner, mouthwash and body lotion. We had breakfast in Juno which was very good, but expensive ($43 for two). The waitress seemed like she just woke up and never really seemed like she wanted to be there. We took a three hour bus tour around Seattle that I highly recommend provided by Tours Northwest. The hotel also has a car service on hand that we used for travel back and forth from the airport and Pier 91. Cale Car Service is very reasonably priced, and offers personal service. After a week cruise, we arrived back at the Arctic Club and this time we had a room on the 9th floor. Atleast twice as large as the first room with a seating lounge area. The room was outfitted the same as smaller room. I would not want to stay at this hotel if the smaller room was the only one available. Front desk and Conceirge (Stephen) were very helpful during our stays. Hotel is within walking distance to downtown and waterfront (Ask front desk for a great map). We enjoyed the walks and felt very safe on any street. Several coffee shops, restaurants and sandwich shops on every corner. I couldn't resist a bundle of flowers for only $10 at Pike's Market even though I could only enjoy them for three days. The hotel kindly provided a vase which I left for the hotel staff to enjoy upon our departure.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This hotel was a great choice for us. It is literally 2 minutes from the station for the train to the airport, which was very handy. It is not far out of town but I did not enjoy the number of homeless people heading away from town - so make sure you head towards the city centre and not towards the international district if you are walking around. Its very handy for Pioneer Square and the Underground tour though. The rooms are nice and big and you get a chocolate chip cookie when you arrive - which i appreciated as it was 8 am and my room was ready - hurray! The bathrooms are not very big but they are very nicely decorated. Most channels on the tv don't seem to work but there is a dvd player and a cd player with ipod dock.
reviews.title: Nice one off hotel - location good for airport and town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was so bad we never checked in! We were shown 3 different rooms and all were small and had an odor! The bellman however was absolutely the greatest and tried his best to please us without success. He called us a cab and we went to the Fairmont.
reviews.title: Horrible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will absolutely return to this hotel when in Seattle! The rate was very reasonable, especially compared to the surrounding hotels and given that it was labour day weekend. We checked into our room after having our car valet parked and bags brought in, and each recieved a warm cookie at the front desk by the friendly staff! We then were ushered to our stunning room, located on the first floor in what used to be an old Tea Room. The entire building is gorgeous, and used to be a former Men's Club during the Gold Rush days. They have kept much of the original architecture including the crown moldings and vaulted ceilings. Our room was beautiful with a jetted tub and king size bed (with great bedding!). We mentioned we were on our honeymoon and were sent a complimentary bottle of champagne. We also order room service which came fast with friendly service. The room was spacious, quiet and just what we were looking for! Can't wait to return!
reviews.title: Great spot, beautiful room, will return for sure!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While I read a few poor comments on Trip Advisor about this facility, I was leary, but it was close to the train station and we had an early train to catch to Vancouver for our cruise, so we went ahead. We arrived early morning; having come from the east coast and while the room was not ready they welcomed us, processed the paperwork, took all our luggage, including laptop, provided directions and how to get around and said they would call once the room was ready. Everything worked as planned, we had a great mini adventure in Seattle, went to the space needle and then they called and said the room was ready. Great room, amazing historic hotel, fantastic staff, great bed. Very pleased, would definitely stay here again even though it is somewhat of a distance from the hustle and buslte of the downtown Seattle happenings.
reviews.title: Wonderful Historic Hotel, Excellent Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed here for three nights and these people are fabulous. From the moment I pulled up, they took great care of me. Traveling alone isn't always easy, but the staff here at the Arctic Club went out of their way to make sure I was comfortable. The valet knew my name by the second day, and my car was out and ready within five minutes every time. The Juno restaurant has an excellent small menu and nice wine list. The rooms are small, but well appointed and clean. I would give this place six stars if possible.
reviews.title: The only place in downtown Seattle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Transportation is also a great asset for this hotel. Third Street has buses that run down to the downtown shopping area for no charge, and it's an easy walk to Pioneer Square as well. Lots of other restaurants within two blocks, and the concierge is always happy to recommend something specific.
reviews.title: How Can You Not Love A Hotel That Has Walruses on the Facade?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located on Pioneer Square, steps from the light rail station, this is a wonderful hotel in a beautifully restored building. The hotel tries to catch the ambiance of early twentieth century Seattle without sacrificing modern convenience. The rooms are spacious and beautifully appointed. The staff is well trained, considerate and professional. Take a moment to visit the dome room with its leaded glass ceiling or just wander around the lobby looking at the souvenirs from Seattle's past. Connections to the airport through the light rail line are convenient and the hotel is in easy walking distance of museums and the public library. The famous fish market is a bit longer walk but is still easily done.
reviews.title: Classic and Lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located in a beautifully restored classic building this is a gem worth visiting. Of course, in a 100 year old building ADA access is not a forte; the main entrance off Cherry Street is a set of steep stairs off a sloping sidewalk. Once inside, the lobby is home to a gracious and spacious Polar Bar Lounge. Our room was a corner jacuzzi that was roomy and comfortable. The closet was a nice size but dark enough to require a flashlight to find anything. Bonus points for an actual tea kettle; especially nice for us tea drinkers who don't appreciate making tea with coffee tainted water. The HVAC is noisy but the room temperature can be maintained.
reviews.title: Romantic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel on our Wedding Night. We wanted a nice hotel that was close to Pioneer Square. This Hotel really fit the bill. We got greeted with warm chocolate chip cookies when we checked in. All the hotel staff were very nice and extremely helpful. As this was our wedding night they even gave us a late checkout.
reviews.title: Loved the Decor', ambience, the amenities..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Extremely disappointed with the very small room, especially as a loyal (diamond) customer. Hardly room for 2 people to be comfortable. Lighting was very dim, I'm sure on purpose to provide old-style mood but was not practical either for reading, or for use in the bathroom. Everything else about the hotel was ok.
reviews.title: Very small room; dim lighting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a beautiful hotel. it is a restored gentleman's club and they've managed to capture that vintage feel in the hotel and in the rooms as well. Beautiful architectural details throughout the building, the dome room on the 3rd floor was especially impressive. We stayed on the 3rd floor in a corner room. check in was a breeze, we arrived early from Vancouver on Amtrak and our room was ready. The room had 10 foot ceilings, lot of windows, beautiful bathroom, the only complaint I had about the room itself is it's too dim. I know it's in keeping with the atmosphere of the hotel, but I prefer a well lit room. Now to the street noise. Our room faced 3rd Ave on one side where buses ran all hours of the day and night, the bus stop was right under our window. we heard garbage trucks, recycling trucks, which all seemed to collect after 11pm at night. On our last night we were woken up about 4-5 times during the night from street noise. so although the beds and the room were very comfortable, our sleep was always interrupted. If you do stay here, ask for a room away from 3rd ave.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but too much street noise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were trying to avoid the typical hotel chains but based on the reviews and description decided to take a chance on the Doubletree Artic Club. We were not disappointed! Despite the "Doubletree" label, it felt more like a trendy, boutique hotel than a major chain. The classic, "social club" style came through in the unique architecture and elegant lobby. The walrus-theme added a fun element and the fireplace made it feel very cozy.
reviews.title: In a word...Fabulous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was warm and welcoming and checkin was quick & easy. Loved the chocolate chip cookies upon arrival! (We promptly made Starbucks coffee in the room with our french press to enjoy with our cookies. Nice touch!) We opted for a corner room which was totally worth the upgrade. We had windows all around and the room was lovely. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the whirlpool tub was a very nice addition. The only slight issue was the low lighting. Very romantic at night but not ideal for getting ready to go out.
reviews.title: Loved It

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The entire staff was so helpful and friendly (especially Stephen who spent additional time with us making suggestions on restaurants and getting us familiarized with the area and public transportation options.) We had dinner our first night at the Polar Bar and it was one of our best meals of the trip! My husband also tried Absinthe for the first time. Interesting. We ordered room service for breakfast the day we left to save time and it was excellent as well.
reviews.title: luxurious rooms - best night's sleep in a hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If the Art of Shaving designed a hotel I imagine this is what it would be like. Loved the decor and cozy feel to the place. Had corner room on top floor (10th) with a balcony. Seating area with club chairs and couch as well as a desk. Breakfast at restaurant also tasty. Only complaint was that the wine by the glass selection was middling at best. Then again, in this setting with the prints of notable Seattlites from the 1920s and pool table adorning the lobby, it may have been a better call to have gone with the martini. Easy walk to most attractions or quick bus ride to places like Space Needle. More of a business hotel than a place to go for a romantic getaway but lots of character. Staff was also very friendly.
reviews.title: Perfect Gentelmen's Club

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: The service was good. The cookie they gave me was tasty. The place was... rustic. I understand that was their theme, but my toilet was broken when I came into the room and the dresser is an old school awkward design that I did not enjoy using. I had to open three sets of doors to get my underwear in the morning...
reviews.title: Nothing to be excited about

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The flat screen tv was nice, but kind of awkwardly situated. The lobby downstairs however is pretty cool. They have a nice rustic themed bar and a pool table for use, which is pretty nice.
reviews.title: A grand historic hotel with wonderful rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: The staff was super nice and friendly, and the hotel is situated right above the underground bus which can take you to the main shopping area two stops away. The street traffic is pretty loud, but the noise of the vents to heat the room was even louder. I did not really mind either of these as I am a heavy sleeper as it is. There was no view from the room which I was not too happy about, but other than all of these things my stay was adequate.
reviews.title: Loved the hotel
Lovely, Original Hotel
reviews.text: I wouldn't mind coming back, but I am not pining for it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010
reviews.text: The front desk staff at the hotel were extremely unfriendly and unwelcoming. The hotel is in a great location, nice, clean rooms, but for the price I expected decent customer service. It was obvious that the staff didn't want to deal with customers - from check in, to later when we asked for directions to a nearby restaurant. No breakfast, no cookies, nothing offered for free. They definitely did not live up to Hilton standards. We stayed at a Hampton in Oregon, on our way to Seattle, and the experience was the opposite - extremely friendly, welcoming staff.....WITH breakfast, for a much lower price.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but terrible customer service. Wouldn't stay here again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely hotel - great staff, lovely room (well - we got upgraded to a suite, though the room we had before the upgrade was pretty darn good!) - really great location - easy walk to centre of Seattle / ferry / pioneer square; super easy free bus service using the Seattle bus tunnels to wherever you wanted. $2.70 to/from the airport on the new light rail service - drops you off at Pioneer station (3rd and James is the exit you want) - maybe a whole 30 feet from the door of the hotel. Video on demand for a couple of nights in watching a movie. We stayed 13 nights... Restaurant on the ground floor a bit pricey for what it was, but there's plenty of better places to eat in Seattle. Would we stay again? Heck yes!
reviews.title: Gentleman's club style with great rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have always stayed at a Doubletree hotel no matter where the location. It is always where I search for when we start researching destination. After this experience NEVER AGAIN. Upon check in we were informed that our reservation was cancelled due to not showing up on time. I had called a day in advance to inform them that we would be arriving the next morning but had booked an extra day so that our room would be ready upon arrival. We were placed in a temporary room until our room was ready. For inconveniencing us they gave a certificate for a dinner for 2 at Juno. The restaurant below. It was AWFUL. Food was bad and found a hair in the bread. Not just dropped in but actually baked in the bread. Ok so we had perfect weather and "Seattle was great. We thought everything was good..until I got home. I prepaid for a discounted room rate prior to leaving for Seatlle. Well I guess with the mess up in cancelling our reservation they also charged us again for our stay. I called to have Hilton reverse the charges and they had informed me that they already did and that the location was responsible for the error. The hotel had charged the card that I had used to book the reservation and credited the card that I had used upon check in for incidentals. Upon receipt of my credit card bill I see that they had a field day with my credit card. Charging over $2500 ...I called them once again. They stated even though they had erroneously charged my credit card numerous amounts of time they ultimately gave me the correct credit. So tough luck for me.
reviews.title: Never again will I stay at a Doubletree Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed one night at this location to leave the next mroning on a cruise.
reviews.title: Great place & location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was excellent (clean, very comfy bed), the front desk staff was very helful, the doorman helped with baggage and places to eat nearby & the location is great for Pikes Market and only a half block from the light rail line from the airport that cost us around $2.50 in cost. Room had excellent decor. and the bed was soooo comfy. Go two blocks to the bay and there are great places to eat.
reviews.title: Wonderful Classic Hotel

description: The Arctic Club Seattle - a DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel in the heart of the downtown Seattle financial district is a landmark Seattle hotel, rich in history and beautifully restored to provide the best in contemporary Doubletree hospitality. We have received the AAA 4-Diamond Award three consecutive years. Our modern luxury hotel is conveniently located just off of I-5, only three blocks from Pioneer Square, close to Seattle's International District, CenturyLink Field (home to the Seahawks and Sounders) and Safeco Field. Seattle-Tacoma International Airport (SEA) is only 30 minutes south by car. Enjoy free daytime bus transportation to dozens of downtown Seattle attractions, like vibrant Pike Place Market and the Puget Sound waterfront.From the distinctive third-floor walrus heads overlooking the street, to the fine Alaskan marble foyer, to the magnificent Northern Lights Dome Room with its enchanting Rococo gilt and leaded stained glass ceiling, The Arctic Club Hotel in Seattle offers a unique hotel experience harkening back to the post-Klondike gold rush days of the early 1900s. Our tastefully-appointed hotel features modern conveniences suited to the savvy business traveler, as well as a central Seattle location and amenities to please leisure guests. Stylish guest rooms, suites, and executive accommodations boast a long list of guest amenities, flat panel HDTVs, our luxurious Sweet Dreams beds, and wireless high-speed internet access. Some rooms feature jetted tubs and outdoor terraces. Other hotel amenities include: •Remote printing capabilities •Wireless HSIA in public areas throughout the hotel •A Precor®-equipped Fitness Center •In-room dining
